title: Pakistan elevates its Kabul diplomatic representation from CdA to ambassador
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 30 (APP):Pakistan on Friday announced to elevate its diplomatic representation in Afghanistan from Chargé d’Affaires to Ambassador level as bilateral ties move on a positive trajectory.
Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Senator Ishaq Dar, in a social media post on X, announced decision of elevating the representation, as an outcome of his “very productive” visit to Kabul on April 19.
“Pakistan-Afghanistan relations are on positive trajectory after my very productive visit to Kabul with Pakistan delegation on 19th April 2025. To maintain this momentum, I am pleased to announce the decision of the Government of Pakistan to upgrade the level of its Chargé d’Affaires in Kabul to the level of Ambassador,” he wrote on his timeline.
The deputy prime minister expressed the confidence that the step would further contribute towards enhanced engagement, deepen Pak-Afghan cooperation in economic, security, counter-terrorism, and trade.
Besides, it would also help promote further exchanges between two fraternal countries, he added.
